scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
JSON is included in 2 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands and Slovenia. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
JSON strongly supports Tim Berners Lee's 5-star schema for open data. The adoption of JSON fosters the publication of data as open data by means of providing structured data and the usage of non-proprietary formats. Moreover, it helps to link data by means of embedding metadata. 

See: 
https://www.europeandataportal.eu/sites/default/files/european_data_portal_-_open_data_goldbook.pdf
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
ECMA International has clearly defined the procedures that have to be carried out in order to publish standards or technical reports. The procedures are defined in a set of documents that can be found at ECMA's webpage. 

ECMA International’s decision procedure is basically a two-step process: The first decision step takes place on the level of the Technical Committee (TC) level where consensus is the primary target.  The second step is approval at the ECMA International General Assembly.

See:
http://www.ecma-international.org/memento/policies.htm

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
The Executive Committee has to review and co-ordinate the progress of the TCs and, from time to time, review the terms of reference given to Technical Committees. 

In addition, the Technical Committee shall review and approve the minutes of the preceding meeting. The minutes, after approval, shall constitute the official record of the meeting of a TC

See:
http://www.ecma-international.org/memento/policies.htm

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
JSON is available for its use, study and implementation at ECMA International and EITF's webpages. 
See:
https://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-404.htm
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
ECMA International's purpose is to make available the developed standards and specifications in a non-discriminatory and free of charges. Therefore, JSON is licensed under (F)RAND and Royalty-free basis. Terms and conditions for IPR disclosures can be found in ECMA's webpage. 
See:
http://www.ecma-international.org/memento/Ecma%20IPR%20policies.htm

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis
statement:
ECMA International's purpose is to make available the developed standards and specifications in a non-discriminatory and free of charges. Therefore, JSON is licensed under (F)RAND and Royalty-free basis. Terms and conditions for IPR disclosures can be found in ECMA's webpage. 
See:
http://www.ecma-international.org/memento/Ecma%20IPR%20policies.htm

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Douglas Crockford was the creator of JSON. The system was sold to Sun Microsystems, Amazon.com and EDS. The website of the specification was launched in 2002. JSON reuses conventions from other programming languages, in consequence, many libraries of programming use it. Therefore, it is demonstrated that JSON has enough maturity and market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services. 

See:
https://www.json.org/json-en.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: Currently, JSON is a widely used specification for data interchange between applications and platforms. It is used in a REST API applications in order to ensure data exchange, this application is extensively used for the creation of solutions, including innovative ones.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
JSON is available for its use an implementation at ECMA International and EITF's webpages. 
See:
https://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-404.htm
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: JSON is a specification used for data exchange between different platforms, this fact facilitates the visibility and comprehensibility of administration's data. Moreover, it eases the communication between administrations enhancing the decision-making process.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: The purpose of JSON is not related to ensuring the availability of interfaces. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement: JSON sector agnostic specification that can be reused in any business domain requiring a common format to exchange data between different programs.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.

statement:
JSON is available for its use an implementation at ECMA International and EITF's webpages. 
See:
https://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-404.htm
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259#section-14.1

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement: JSON is a text format that is completely language independent.  The specification uses conventions that are familiars to C-family of languages, including C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Perl, Python, and many others. For these reasons, JSON is an optimum data exchange and interchange language.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
JSON is a lightweight specification that allows data exchange between different applications fostering interoperability and data visibility. The specification is scarcely used for document exchange. Therefore, JSON adoption does not hamper the interoperability and scalability of systems. 

See:
https://www.json.org/xml.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: By allowing the data exchange between applications and systems talking different languages JSON fosters the data portability of European public services.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement: As a key enabler for the data exchange and interchange between administrations and stakeholders, JSON enhances the communication and information exchange across borders between public administrations. Therefore, the adoption of the specification avoids citizens and businesses to provide information in several times.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of JSON is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement: JSON in itself does not provide security features, which is a weakness per se. The storage of private date as JSON format is not recommended in order to avoid malicious activities against stored information. Despite this, there are several additional features with the aim of protecting data exchange.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement: JSON is a data-interchange format is used by APIs, which are involved in the delivery of information between platforms, and in consequence service delivery. This fact makes JSON an element that fosters de delivery of European Public services, including multilingual ones.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: JSON allows the data exchange and consumption from different administrations stakeholders. Ensuring data exchange through applications avoids the interaction by means of reducing the non-digital data exchange. Therefore, the adoption of JSON eases the reduction of administrative burden.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement: The purpose of JSON is not related to long-term preservation of electronic records. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are already existing documents and studies assessing the JSON's features and performance. In some cases, the study has been carried out in a comprehensive comparison between XML and JSON. 
See: 
https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Hanif_Ullah/publication/321361853_Behavior_based_Comparative_analysis_of_XML_and_JSON_web_technologies/links/5a1eb56f0f7e9b9d5e000bfd/Behavior-based-Comparative-analysis-of-XML-and-JSON-web-technologies.pdf 
https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Kamir_Yusof/publication/320045078_Efficiency_of_JSON_for_data_retrieval_in_big_data/links/5a3f14ea458515f6b0456f54/Efficiency-of-JSON-for-data-retrieval-in-big-data.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
JSON is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, JSON can define the interoperability aspects of the "Machine to machine interface" ABB of the EIRA Technical View. In addition, JSON can define also the "representation" ABB of the EIRA semantic view. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are several existing mechanisms to assess JSON conformity. Different types of validators depending on users’ needs.
See: 
https://github.com/nst/JSONTestSuite
https://jsoncompare.com/#!/simple/
https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement:
5 Member States are recommending JSON in their ICT National Catalogues. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
The specification has been selected as one of the key elements for the data interchange between administrations and stakeholders. 

Europeana is using JSON within the Search API, the method created to diving into the european cross-border project data. These features allow retrieving information from EUROPEANA. 

Moreover, the Single Electronic Data Interchange Area (SEDIA) is using JSON as the basis to make data available for stakeholders. Examples SEDIA activity is the Call for Tenders, a key point on European eProcurement. Additionally, the EU Open Data Portal is another cross-border initiative that relies on JSON as a message format for API’s communication. 

See: 
https://pro.europeana.eu/resources/apis/search
https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/portal/screen/support/apis
http://data.europa.eu/euodp/en/data/dataset/eu-open-data-portal-api

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 5 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Some examples of Member States including JSON on their catalogues are the Netherlands, Spain or Belgium.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement: Nowadays, JSON is not included in any supra-national catalogue of standards.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No formal interoperability agreement has been found involving European public services providers.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement: After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of JSON is not related  to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of JSON is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement: JSON is defining a set of rules to format data in order to ensure the proper data exchange between applications and platforms. Even defining rules, it can not be considered as a data model in itself, therefore, JSON is not defining a cross-sector data model.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
JSON highly supports Tim Berners Lee's 5 star schema for open data. The adoption of JSON fosters the publication of data as open data by means of providing structured data and the usage of non-proprietary formats. Moreover, it helps to link data by means of embedding metadata. 

Moreover, there is an existing extension of JSON which aims to help and support the Linked Open Data environments. The extension has been developed by the W3C working group specifically in charge of JSON-LD development. Additionally, the W3C has developed a syntax for RDF serialisation using JSON, and JSON-LD is recommended. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/community/json-ld/
https://json-ld.org

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
JSON is available for free at the European Collaborative Platform Joinup. 
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/json-rfc7159-javascript-object-notation-json/distribution/json-rfc7159-javascript-object-notation-json
